name: First Principles Thinking
description: Break down complex problems into their most fundamental truths and reason up from there. Essential for innovative problem-solving and avoiding assumptions.

structure.name: Problem Deconstruction
structure.description: Break the problem into its smallest, most fundamental components

structure.name: Assumption Identification
structure.description: List all assumptions and beliefs about the problem/domain

structure.name: Fundamental Truths
structure.description: Identify what is absolutely true and cannot be broken down further

structure.name: Reconstruction
structure.description: Build solutions back up from fundamental truths

structure.name: Validation
structure.description: Test the reconstructed solution against original problem

prompts: What are we trying to solve? Break it down to its core components.
What assumptions am I making about this problem/domain?
What do I know to be absolutely true? What cannot be questioned?
If I started from scratch, how would I solve this using only fundamental truths?
How does this solution compare to existing approaches? What advantages does it have?
when_to_use: When facing complex, ambiguous problems with many existing solutions
When challenging industry norms or established practices
When seeking breakthrough innovations rather than incremental improvements
When existing solutions seem unnecessarily complex or expensive
When you need to justify decisions from fundamental logic
when_not_to_use: When time is critical and quick decisions are needed
When dealing with simple, well-understood problems
When extensive domain expertise already exists and is reliable
When the cost of getting wrong is very high

examples.title: SpaceX Cost Reduction
examples.description: Elon Musk applied first principles to rocketry: 'What are rockets made of? Aerospace-grade aluminum alloys, fuel, etc. What's the cost of those materials? Only 2% of total rocket cost.' This led to building rockets in-house.

examples.title: Online Education Platform
examples.description: Instead of digitizing traditional education, asked: What is learning fundamentally? Knowledge transfer + skill practice + feedback. Built platform around these core elements.

metadata.author: Aristotle (ancient origins), popularized by Elon Musk

validation_status.validation_notes: Core analytical framework - fundamental for systematic innovation
